Description: An internal ID code
Taxonomic order, according to the Handbook of the Birds of the World Alive taxonomy (BirdLife International) circa 2017
Taxonomic family, according to the Handbook of the Birds of the World Alive taxonomy (BirdLife International) circa 2017
Species English common name, according to the Handbook of the Birds of the World Alive taxonomy (BirdLife International) circa 2017
Taxonomic genus and species, according to the Handbook of the Birds of the World Alive taxonomy (BirdLife International) circa 2017
The corresponding tree tip name in the Jetz et al. (2012) Global Bird Tree
A flag noting that this phylogeny name corresponds to multiple rows in the dataset (1 = duplicate rows present; 0 = no duplicates present; NA = not assignable to phylogenetic tip)

A flag noting which species is closer to the phylogeny tip name, for analyses requiring only one entry per tip. Usually the nominate subspecies is flagged (e.g., the tip Pachyptila salvini can be assigned to both P. salvini and P. macgillivrayi; P. salvini is flagged with a 1 and P. macgillivrayi with a 0); otherwise the entry with the fewest NAs is flagged, or chosen arbitrarily.
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'none' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'scrape' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'clearing' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'ring' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having an 'excavation' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'cavity' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'excavation-with-nest' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'mound' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'platform' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'cup' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'dome' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as having a 'dome-and-tube' structure (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as nesting in an 'artificial' location (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as nesting in an 'earth hole' location (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as nesting in a 'ground' location (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as nesting in a 'rock' location (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as nesting in a 'tree hole' location (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as nesting in a 'vegetation' location (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Whether the species has been scored as nesting in a 'water' location (1 = yes, 0 = no, u = uncertain, NA = information not available)
Body mass, from Sheard et al. 2020 Nat Communications
The hand-wing index, a proxy for flight ability and dispersal, from Sheard et al. 2020 Nat Communications
Average breeding range latitude, from Sheard et al. 2020 Nat Communications
Average breeding range temperature, from Sheard et al. 2020 Nat Communications
Average breeding range temperature seasonality, from Sheard et al. 2020 Nat Communications
